snippet: Complaints about noisy dirt bikes and reckless driving by riders who disobey laws are increasing, with more than 200 cases reported this summer alone.
abstract: Complaints about noisy dirt bikes and reckless driving by bikers who ignore traffic laws in New York City are increasing, with more than 200 cases reported in 2013 in summer months alone; more than 1,440 illegal dirt bikes, motorcycles and ATVs were confiscated in the first nine months of 2013, in traffic stops and in raids on places like ministorage facilities.

byline.original: By SARAH MASLIN NIR and J. DAVID GOODMAN

lead_paragraph: Complaints about noisy dirt bikes and reckless driving by riders who disobey laws are increasing, with more than 200 cases reported this summer alone.

headline.main: For New York City’s Dirt Bikers, There Is No Place to Ride
headline.print_headline: For Dirt Bikers in the City, There Is No Place to Ride
